intro: Steironema laevigatum, commonly known as the smoothstemmed steironema, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Steironema laevigatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
